title: Reflection
text:
Reflection on Building a Multi-Page MBA Portfolio with LLMs
‚Ä¢ What worked better as I added pages?
The creation of the portfolio on a website consisting of several pages, which is important to mention that the content belongs to each section and reduced the cognitive load for the reader. The navigation bar included several important pieces of information, which throughout the development of this gave us a solid ‚Äúmind map.‚Äù For me, it provided a starting point for a quick overview of the person, a resume for the main details and personal interests, projects to highlight their professional career, skills/certifications for the validation of competencies, and Contact for direct contact if necessary. The LLM used was very important because it allowed us to brainstorm, generate drafts, and write with a consistent tone. The acceleration of iteration was what we took the most advantage of because it allowed me to make comparisons, choose the most suitable for the job, and make it clear and reader-friendly, as well as stylize different pages without any inconvenience so that the reading of these is constant without losing the meaning of one and the next.
‚Ä¢ Ensuring authenticity and accuracy?
The LLM‚Äôs response, as a basis, generated a document that I appropriated to produce a text that was not original but adapted with the information provided in the resume, which included specific functions, specific dates, tasks that I had actually performed, and tools that I had actually used and that had been useful throughout my professional career. I took on the task of comparing each of the statements generated with the information I had incorporated into the different documents, with a level of detail, nuances, contexts, metrics, and results, to the extent that the contexts allowed me to do so. I checked the consistency and relationship in the timing and technical terminology. Visibly, in an Appendix, I included the prompts and LLM versions that were edited, and the parts that were modified remained in a different format. I also addressed usability aspects such as alternative text for images, hierarchical titles, descriptions for links, and good contrast to make reading enjoyable.
‚Ä¢ What I‚Äôd improve next?
In the evidence I will present below, I intend to enrich this evidence by incorporating brief case PDFs, tool certificates, as well as metrics that can be compared, such as response times, service volumes, accuracy improvements, among others. Additionally, I will continue to improve ARIA (Accessible Rich Internet Application) accessibility, keyboard navigation testing, and color reviews to comply with best practices. I will propose some subtle changes to the image theme so that it remains a simple and professional palette, and I will also include a simple search function on the site so that readers can quickly find what they need. Overall, this multi-page format increased professionalism and clarity; the LLM helped me with ideation and polishing, but accuracy and voice are no longer my sole responsibility.

B) Prompts I Provided to the LLM (Selected, Verbatim)

B1. Global Structure Prompt
You are a UX-savvy writing assistant helping me build a clean, professional multi-page MBA portfolio with Quarto. Deliverables:
‚Ä¢ A site map with 6‚Äì7 pages: Home, Resume, Projects, Skills & Certifications, Contact, Reflection, Appendix.
‚Ä¢ A Quarto navbar outline (file names like index.qmd, resume.qmd, etc.).
‚Ä¢ One 10‚Äì15 word description per page.Style: concise, practical, business-ready; avoid hype. Output in Markdown only.


B2. Home/About Tone Prompt
You are a friendly, UX-savvy writing assistant. Rewrite a short Home/About intro (3‚Äì5 sentences).
‚Ä¢ Goals: approachable, competent, people-centric HR + current culinary practice in Vancouver. Must include: name, MBA Candidate at University Canada West (Vancouver, BC); strengths in Compensation & Benefits, employee services, onboarding; values of clarity, service, and reliable processes; CTAs: ‚ÄúView Resume‚Äù, ‚ÄúView Projects‚Äù, ‚ÄúDownload PDF‚Äù. Output: ‚â§2 short paragraphs, no emojis, no hype.


B3. Resume Tightening Prompt
Tighten resume bullets for these roles (keep employer/location/dates as given):
‚Ä¢ Compensation & Benefits Analyst ‚Äî Shell Licensee (Santo Domingo, DR) (Dec 2021‚ÄìSep 2024)
‚Ä¢ General Analyst ‚Äî Shell Licensee (Dec 2021‚ÄìAug 2024)

‚Ä¢ Rules: 2‚Äì3 bullets per role; action-first verbs; clear outcome/impact where possible; ‚â§140 characters per bullet; no fluff.
‚Ä¢ Output only Markdown lists under each role title.


B4. Projects Formatting Prompt
Turn each project into a compact card with three fields:
‚Ä¢ Overview (1‚Äì2 sentences)
‚Ä¢ Role (my contribution)
‚Ä¢ Outcome (practical result)
Return plain HTML with three div class=‚Äúcard‚Äù blocks that drop into a Quarto page.


B5. Skills/Badges Prompt
‚Ä¢ Return a single Markdown block with inline ‚Äúbadges‚Äù for core HR and professional skills.
‚Ä¢ Format each badge as: <span class="badge">Skill Name</span> separated by spaces/newlines.
‚Ä¢ Include: Compensation & Benefits, Employee Services, Onboarding, Internal Communications, Excel (dashboards), Time Management, Problem-Solving, Teamwork, Customer Service, Spanish & English.

B6. Reflection Prompt
‚Ä¢ Write a 300‚Äì500 word reflection about building a multi-page MBA portfolio with Quarto and LLMs.
‚Ä¢ Cover: (1) what improved when adding pages, (2) how you verified authenticity/accuracy, (3) limits/risks of LLMs and how you mitigated them (citations, manual review, dated notes, style control), (4) what you‚Äôd iterate next (accessibility, performance, content depth).
‚Ä¢ Tone: honest, specific, first person. Output in Markdown (no title).

D) AI Use & APA Citations

D1. Generative-AI Use Statement
I used ChatGPT (GPT-5 Thinking) to support this assignment in bounded, transparent ways:
‚Ä¢ Brainstorming & structure: initial site map and page outlines; I reviewed, reordered, and finalized navigation.
‚Ä¢ Copy help: tone tightening and readability edits for Home, Projects, and Skills; I verified accuracy and rewrote where needed.
‚Ä¢ Code snippets: Quarto/Markdown scaffolds and small CSS utilities (badges, soft-hero gradient). I tested and adjusted locally.
‚Ä¢ Documentation hygiene: selected prompts and outputs are included in Appendix B‚ÄìC; diffs and rationales are noted inline.
‚Ä¢ Limits & authenticity. All facts (education, work history, skills) reflect my real background. I verified every claim, removed hallucinations, and kept authorship control. The website is built locally with Quarto and published via GitHub Pages. I am accountable for the final content.
‚Ä¢ Data & privacy. No private or sensitive data was shared in prompts. No proprietary data was uploaded.
‚Ä¢ Reproducibility. Model & session: ChatGPT (GPT-5 Thinking), Nov 2025. Prompts are archived locally and representative excerpts are shown in Appendix B; selected model outputs are in Appendix C.



D2. APA-Style References (samples)

title: Appendix ‚Äî LLM Artifacts & Revisions
text:
E) Change Log & Rationale
E1. Major edits across drafts
‚Ä¢ Home: Replaced long intro with a concise value statement; added clear CTAs (View Resume, Projects, Download PDF).
‚Ä¢ Resume: Tightened bullets to action-first outcomes; limited to 2‚Äì3 bullets/role; removed filler.
‚Ä¢ Projects: Standardized 3-card layout (Overview ¬∑ Role ¬∑ Outcome) for quick scanning.
‚Ä¢ Skills & Certifications: Switched to compact ‚Äúbadges‚Äù for readability on mobile.
‚Ä¢ Contact: Simplified to essentials (location, email, LinkedIn, resume link).
‚Ä¢ Theme/UX: Added soft gradient background, improved spacing, and consistent heading scale.
E2. Why these changes? (Rationales)
‚Ä¢ Clarity & scannability: Recruiters skim; compact sections and consistent patterns reduce cognitive load.
‚Ä¢ Outcome focus: Bullets emphasize impact, not tasks‚Äîclearer value for HR roles.
‚Ä¢ Accessibility: Larger line-height, badge contrast, and predictable navigation improve readability.
‚Ä¢ Authenticity: All facts (work history, skills) were verified and kept in my own voice.
E3. What I did NOT include (and why)
‚Ä¢ Leadership/Community/Publication pages: Deferred to future iterations to keep scope manageable and maintain quality.
‚Ä¢ Long-form narrative: Avoided long paragraphs in Resume/Projects to favor scannable content.
E4. Risks & mitigations
‚Ä¢ Risk: Visual polish might distract from content.
Mitigation: Kept color accents subtle, prioritized typography and spacing.
‚Ä¢ Risk: Overfitting to one audience.
Mitigation: Kept language professional-general; industry specifics live inside project cards.
E5. Evidence of authorship
‚Ä¢ All data points (dates, roles, responsibilities) map to my CV and personal records.
‚Ä¢ Prompts and selected outputs are archived in this Appendix (Sections B‚ÄìC).
‚Ä¢ Local build logs and commit history show progressive edits (see Git history timeline).
